item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

The Experimentation and Incubation practice, part of CIBC’s Enterprise Innovation team, is a team specialized on bringing innovation to life – we combine data science and modern development techniques to create tangible tools, concepts, and prototypes. We are leading the way in applying the best practices in machine learning, natural language processing, and artificial intelligence, and the latest in advanced analytics technology platforms. As a Senior Data Scientist you will apply your knowledge and experience of data modelling to solve challenging business problems and bringing innovative solutions to life. You’ll interact with groups across the organization from client facing, operational risk and capital markets. You’ll work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with the most exciting new companies in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage in collaborations with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

How you’ll succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: Conduct guided and self-directed research, typically using non-traditional resources to solve business problems. Conduct detailed analysis of data sets, incorporating machine learning and statistical methods and models. Provide advanced analytics using various advanced analytical techniques including statistical modeling (including model programming and coding), predictive modeling and machine-learning  
  • Business Consulting: Participate in gathering and analysis of relevant information related to business processes, functions and operations to evaluate data credibility. Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach that results in providing optimum solutions to business and technology issues/challenges. Perform in-depth analysis of research information for the purpose of identifying opportunities, developing proposals and recommendations for use by management. Make recommendations and create presentations on new ways to use data to help solve business problems
  • Market Relevance: Participate in an analytics community whose goal is to foster and share analytic approaches across the enterprise. Liaise with internal and external sources, colleagues, and others to obtain, provide, verify and discuss information and best practices. Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working with large datasets including both structured and unstructured data and related tools (e.g., SQL, MongoDB, NoSQL). Must have experience coding in high level programming languages such as Python or R. Must have experience coding with data modelling packages such as Pandas, Scikit-Learn
  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing in M.S. or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or a related quantitative field.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • Problem Solving: You enjoy being presented with problems or issues and working with a team to find innovative solutions
  • Creativity: You are curious and enjoy working in a team to visualize and design innovative solutions
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 16th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Director, Data Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Director specializing in data science, you’ll be responsible for building the strategy and complex advanced models and AI capabilities for CIBC’s products, services and processes. The Director will also be capable of leading teams of Data Engineers and Software Developers who will leverage their Big Data skills to develop data assets that can be leveraged by the data science team to build advanced models and AI capabilities.

This role is a senior position within the Analytics team and requires a hands-on approach to solving problems, planning and managing change related to all aspects of the client-facing roles related to Analytics and AI initiatives. 

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Champion the use of advanced analytics for solving business problems: Work with various business units to understand their needs, opportunities and pain points.

  • Successfully manage and deliver on key analytical initiatives: Work across the various CIBC lines of business.

  • Oversee and complete the implementation and evaluation of proposed models: Create and validate statistical and ML based approaches that deal with complex data sets.

  • Work closely with business subject matter experts: Understand the context of business problems, perform deep dives on data collection and transformations and develop novel features to enhance model performance.

  • See analytics work through to completion: Oversee the model deployment and handoff to the line of business.

  • Support modelling efforts: Periodically refresh or revise as business needs evolve.

  • Become the trusted analytical partner for the leadership of the various CIBC lines of business: Focus on client / partner satisfaction. Mentor junior data scientists on modelling and coding best practices, as well as coaching on how to make analytical work relevant to business partners.

  • Help teams in Advanced Analytics tell a business story: Develop executive presentations that will support their initiatives.

  • Provide subject matter expertise on business analytics: Integrate and align business initiatives with Advance Analytics mandates and objectives.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate advanced knowledge of decision science, data science, advanced modelling and advanced analytical techniques.

  • You have extensive hands-on experience with modern data science and machine learning languages and toolkits including: Python, Pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, Pytorch, SQL. Additionally, you have strong coding skills, knowledge of DevOps tooling and and experience with one or more cloud services.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have an M.S. or Ph.D. in Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or equivalent degree.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Director, Strategic Development, ADA
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Director, Strategic Development, Architecture, Data & Analytics (ADA) is responsible for developing and driving the strategic direction across ADA. You will be working collaboratively with business stakeholders, technology partners and vendors leading cross-functional efforts to put in place strategic transformation and integration activities in order to build roadmaps and action plans for architecture, data, governance and analytics solutions. The Director manages relationships with senior business partners, maintaining continuous business communications with them to proactively plan and deliver business value.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Develop ADA Strategy: including the strategic roadmap for Architecture, Data & Analytics with a focus on building leadership in support of the continued transformation of data, analytics, governance and architecture solutions. Design and deliver robust business cases through their required governance lifecycle and report on the portfolio initiatives to the Investment Operations Board (IOB) including benefits realization. Manage pipeline and funding to determine prioritization for new initiatives by developing a framework to monitor, forecast and prioritize the overall work/portfolio of projects for ADA

  • Thought Leadership: Be a thought leader in transformation initiatives to optimize ADA’s capability, efficiency and effectiveness that would lead to key competitive advantages of our bank in the future. Leveraging a strong understanding of the industry, assessing market opportunities to establish a forward looking view that positions each team within ADA for sustained success with a focus on innovation and simplification

  • Relationship Management: Directly partner with business and technology partners to develop roadmaps and plans for ADA strategies; identify opportunities to leverage technology to meet business goals, increase efficiency and create robust platforms that support operational excellence. Liaise with third party vendors regarding potential solutions, assessment opportunities or proof of concepts

  • Strong Leadership – Well-developed management and leadership skills sufficient to achieve results within a matrix organization, including the ability to influence at a senior level. Lead and coach a high performing team of individuals. Direct, motivate, and develop the team, maximizing their contributions and professional growth. Share knowledge and collaborate to come up with effective solutions to problems.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of experience in developing imaginative solutions and new ways of thinking about situations, problems and opportunities. Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, practices and procedures required to develop best practice, knowledge-based business systems and strategic capability. Comprehensive knowledge of financial services practices and principles sufficient to analyze and interpret complex concepts and apply these in innovative ways. Understanding of mission critical delivery systems, including business resumption and contingency. Ability to apply these competencies within an integrated and complex business environment involving multiple vendors and/ or solutions

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes through your excellent problem solving and decision making abilities. You demonstrate team player qualities through your ability to lead and motivate others. 

  • You are a bold and accountable leader. You have experience developing and implementing strategic team goals. You have experience coaching employees and driving successful team performance.

  • You can demonstrate experience in strategy development, business case management and agile methodologies

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You have the ability to analyze data and reports with the goal of developing potential opportunities. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Business management, Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study, MBA is an asset

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do. 

  • You embrace and champion change. You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best, in a fast paced environment with a high degree of change and multiple priorities 

  • You’re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create shared vision.  

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. 

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics (RESL)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing­­

The Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking Real Estate Secured Lending product line. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader and subject matter expert in Real Estate Secured Lending– Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements

  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.

  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.

  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.

  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).

  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

  • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance.
  • Conduct pre and post-analyses of acquisition strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance.
  • Quantify and grade risk-adjusted profit as well as credit risk performance.
  • Actively monitor the performance of key origination strategies.  Alert senior management to any signs of potential emerging risk or performance degradation.
  • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria.  Assess the merits of adjudication cutoffs and rules logic for TTD and campaign channels.  Ensure that cutoffs align with RACD’s risk appetite.
  • Play a lead role in managing the TTD decision engine simulation environment.
  • Ensure accuracy and integrity of data throughout the analytical process.  Play a lead role in continuously improving the breadth and quality of available data.
  • Invoke champion/challenger methodologies as appropriate.
  • Build and maintain sound working relationships with key business partner groups such as Product Management, Technology, etc.
  • Design and build new tracking and reporting capabilities to evaluate strategy performance.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • The candidate would be required to have extensive knowledge of how to develop dynamic dashboards, charts and graphs that senior leadership can drill down into and use to understand trends.
  • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team.
  • Being able to develop dynamic dashboards (in Tableau/PowerBI) that can be used for different types of views into the data.
  • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
  • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
  • Strong experience in Python is essential and the candidate must be able to manipulate and analyze large, complex datasets in addition to being able to build their own datasets from existing data sources.
  • Knowledge of Data science and Analytics concepts is essential as candidate will be expected to support model development efforts in the Risk Modelling sphere.
  • Experience with models like Decision Trees. Random Forest, XG Boost as well as associated concepts such as hyper parameter tuning, model validation and model monitoring.
  • Must be comfortable communicating complex ideas during presentations in a simple and concise manner to facilitate understanding.
  • Should be able to use data and visuals to derive narratives that explain trends and insights.
  • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data.
  • Comfortable working in Excel and Python to perform complex financial calculations that are dynamically updated with new inputs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in principles of credit analysis and risk management relating to retail lending portfolios.  Prior experience in retail credit is an asset.
  • You have a strong financial background and can understand financial information in the portfolio as well as spot and explain anomalies.
  • Ability to interpret and analyze information to formulate solutions.  Strong problem solving skills evidenced by a proven track record.
  • Experience with acquisition risk strategy development, including implementation via automated risk management systems such as Decision Manager, Capstone is an asset.
  • Knowledge of advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables and charts, string manipulation, lookups, and filters.
  • Knowledge of at least one dashboarding software (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
  • Strong experience in Python, SAS and SQL is a pre-requisite.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. item.title: Consultant, Data Governance
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Data Governance & Management team is responsible for proactive management and governance of all PBB Data assets. This includes leading and managing all Data Governance activities and ensuring PBB is in compliance with both internal and external policies & procedures. The team is also responsible for helping analytics teams in PBB better leverage data by helping them get the data needed for their analysis. In short, this team enables PBB with good quality data.

You’ll join our Analytics & Decision Science team reporting into the Director, Data Management & Governance. As a Business Consultant, you’ll support all Personal & Business Banking (PBB) data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and managing the protection of sensitive data and information assets. You’ll focus on ensuring adherence to the data governance policies and procedures and have a direct impact on the business by helping to implement and maintain business processes for successful data governance and quality within PBB.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Governance – Support the classification of data elements and identification of critical data elements. Maintain inventory of PBB applications and data governance roles. Maintain a list of roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets in accordance with Enterprise Data Governance policies. Support the remediation of data governance deficiencies across PBB.  Contribute towards ongoing data quality improvement initiatives.
  • Compliance & Adherence - Monitor performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements. Monitor adherence to data policies across the organization to ensure availability of high-quality data, consultative and subject matter expertise, ensuring all users of data understand policies, procedures and standards.
  • Project Management – Responsible for the execution of work streams under our data governance project and the ongoing maintenance and monitoring of data governance activities to ensure that PBB remains in compliance. Assist to roll out PBB wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture. Contribute to successful completion of data governance project deliverables.  Participate in project and team meetings, interact and collaborate with team members and other departments as appropriate

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 3 years’ experience in supporting data governance procedures including measuring/monitoring data quality, recommending improvements in data, data classification and data governance capabilities. You have 2 years’ experience working with Personal Banking products including the experience and knowledge of data governance in a cross-functional environment of multiple data sources/repositories. It’s recommended that you have at least one year of experience in process engineering.
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

item.title: Senior Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Client Analytics and Forecasting team has the objective to provide senior management with the necessary information for the retail lending portfolios so they have a good understanding of the risk profile of the existing portfolios which is critical to ensuring the sustainable performance that CIBC’s risk appetite demands.

As a Senior Consultant Client Analytics and Forecasting, you will be developing advanced statistical models that evaluate credit risk and stress testing across a variety of retail credit portfolios including credit cards, personal loans and lines of credit, residential mortgages and small business loans. You will also contribute to the profitable growth of personal lending portfolios by independently and proactively performing the activities that support the performance monitoring, portfolio loss forecasting and analytics for the credit cards, residential mortgages, secured and unsecured lines/loans portfolios including student loans. Also, the successful candidate will write technical model documentation to support the model vetting and validation process. You will also improve forecasting processes and methodologies, identify weaknesses and close the gap of inefficiencies, explore new data sources, and develop deeper understanding of clients.

Proactively identify opportunities within the personal lending portfolio operations where analytical techniques can be effectively applied to achieve core business objectives. Consulting with business partners, assessing each unit’s needs and developing an analytical plan to demonstrate the range of options and potential impacts.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in Economics, Finance or other applicable discipline.
  • You have a graduate degree in areas with exposure to statistical or machine learning coursework (Statistics, Math, Data Analytics, Economics, Finance, Data Science).
  • You can demonstrate experience in working with SAS (Enterprise Guide, Enterprise Miner) or similar analytical tools (i.e. SQL, Python, R), Tableau, VBA, Excel macros, Hyperion Essbase planning systems and databases.
  • You can develop and execute statistical/machine learning models for all retail risk systems. Understand and generate critical actionable insights from data.
  • You have good understanding of stress testing models, credit cards, residential mortgages, secured/unsecured lines and loans business.
  • You are familiar with best practices in forecasting methodologies and innovative analytical tools, and can leverage this knowledge to enhance NCL management strategies.
  • You are proficient in Financial Analysis and develop and maintain models to forecast retail lending NCL. Complete trend, performance and variance analysis; reviewing financial information to ensure risks are identified and underlying causes of variances are understood. Provide financial impacts of various scenarios and “what if” situations; develop specialized reporting and performs ad-hoc analysis.
  • You will ensure the timely, accurate and informative delivery of “forward looking” information to assist in senior leader decision support. This includes preparation of the NCL Annual Financial Plan, Quarterly Financial Forecasts and Latest Estimates. In addition, this position provides guidance on planning and forecasting NCL for the retail lending portfolio while acting as the central consolidator of this information. This role also involved in the ongoing analysis and interpretation of NCL to ensure relevant issues are highlighted to senior management.
  • You will prepare and communicate insightful analysis including, variance analyses and prior period performance.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You are skillful in evaluating complex data relationships and developing fact based reports and presentations on the knowledge gained from the analysis; being able to generate insights and recommend solutions to problems and present the outcomes.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

How You’ll Succeed

  • You exhibit CIBC’s values of trust, team work, and accountability
  • You will frequently liaise with other departments to establish collaborative relationships, provide expertise, and communicate forecasting estimates.
  • You will be responsible for data-driven forecasts that enhance efficiency and predictability.
  • You are keen in problem solving
  • You process good writing and visual presentation skills sufficient to articulate the results of analysis performed
  • You have well-developed communication skills to facilitate development of good working relationships within CIBC
  • You are able to execute job functions with minimal supervision

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

These data capabilities will help create long term sustainable strategic differentiation between our bank and the competition. This includes attending regular meetings to discuss new initiatives and planned promotion schedules in order for us to be able to synchronize our system with such upstream changes. In addition, provide support to our BI Developers with business requirements and UAT testing.
  • Collaborate – Work with technology teams that support our systems. They depend on our expertise to provide detailed requirements to implement our initiatives. Strengthen existing mutually beneficial relationships with external teams including the technology team.
  • Project planning and execution - As part of your business intelligence and data management responsibilities, you will participate in managing and tracking various commitments to our clients, helping to ensure that critical deadlines are closely monitored and not compromised.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Management & Research
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

Job Description

What you\'ll be doing

As a member of the Asset Management team and under the direction of the Director, Data Management & Research, you are lead the Data Management & Research team (formerly known as Investment Data Management team) to perform their tasks efficiently and in a timely manner as well as serving as the main point of contact on any data related platforms in scope of the team in regards to data issues/requests. As the Senior Manager, Data Management & Research , you make sure to keep a teamwork, trust and accountability focus environment within the team. You are leading the creation and enhancement of Data Management protocols (including data governance, data quality, data integration, data security etc.) for all data sources and processes required by the various teams at CAM with a focus on the investment teams. As Senior Manager, you also collaborate with other business partners on the development and evolution of the data model used by the current Business Intelligent solution.

You are flexible to work our support coverage hours which may include evenings and/or weekends to deliver a high service level to our data consumers.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1 or 2 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you\'ll succeed

  • Team Management - Lead the team to perform all the required tasks in their relevant application accurately, efficiently and in a timely manner while ensuring the execution quality of those daily, monthly, quarterly tasks and have an extensive understanding of their purpose and mechanic.
  • Data Management - Build and enhance Data Management processes which covers data governance, data quality, data integration, data security principles that are strategic to deliver reliable data to our multiple data consumers.
  • Leveraging Technology - Be the expert on our Business Intelligence ecosystem. Share your knowledge by introducing business partners to our BI solution, enabling them to get data/information faster and better.
  • Relationship building - Engage relationship with key vendors such as RIMES, BNY Mellon, S&P, FTSE etc. Collaborate with key business partners such as Client Portfolio Managers, Quantitative Research team, Product Development team and many others.

Who you are

  • You have a degree/diploma in Finance, Math, business area of concentration, Data Science, Technology or an equivalent combination of education, training, experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required.  A Master’s degree in Finance, Math, business area of concentration, Data Science or Technology is an asset.
  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 10 years experience working experience of financial services industry experience in a data analysis capacity.
  • You can demonstrate experience in domain-specific languages such as SQL, Business Intelligence & Analytics software such as Alteryx and/or QlikSense as well in data management principles and data modelling.

  • You embrace and advocate for change. You continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

item.title: Executive Director, Automated Market Making
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

The goal of CIBC’s capital markets business is to be the premier client-focused wholesale bank based in Canada. To deliver on this, the capital markets arm of CIBC provides a wide range of credit, capital markets, investment banking, and research products and services to government, institutional, corporate and retail clients in Canada and in key markets around the world.

The fixed-income market is undergoing a revolution. Algorithmic market making, ETF technology and portfolio trading have combined to promise greater efficiency and immediacy to bond trading. The ability to process and analyze data through statistical learning, optimization, and data science has opened opportunities for data-centric, cross-asset market-making. The CIBC Automated Market Making team is at the forefront of these developments.

We are looking for someone to lead our fixed income ETF efforts in a front-office trading role, combining traditional bond trading activities with electronic and automated trading desk though statistical models and analytics for fixed-income ETF pricing/market-marking, portfolio pricing/trading, portfolio optimization and hedging. This trading desk participates in all major cash bond product areas.

The desk has a start-up culture where originality and entrepreneurship are highly valued. If you enjoy continuous learning in highly a dynamic market and taking full ownership for quant, technical, and business aspect then this role provides a lot of opportunities for to contribute from the ground-up

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Fixed-income ETF pricing and hedging, creation and redemption strategies.

  • Fixed-income PT pricing and hedging.

  • Custom portfolio optimization.

  • Work with ETF issuers and internal counterparts to structure and develop new products while providing liquidity

  • Help clients at all stages of the ETF process, from product understanding, product selection and best execution strategies to meet their objectives and benchmarks

  • Work within a team to develop & improve analytics libraries used for pricing and risk-management

  • Collaborate closely with other traders, structurers, and technology professionals.

  • Work in close partnership with internal stakeholders to ensure proper risk and business process

  • Build a culture of responsible finance, good governance and supervision, expense discipline and ethics

  • Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions; and ensure that all team members understand the need to do the same, demonstrating proper consideration for the firm’s reputation.

Who Are You

  • Most importantly the candidate should be creative, entrepreneurial and enjoy taking ownership of a project from start to finish.

  • Candidate should have experience and training in one or more of the following areas: financial engineering, machine learning, portfolio optimization and optimization theory, and/or algo pricing/market making.

  • Prior experience with ETF creation/redemption, credit bond portfolio trading and/or credit algo market making is a major plus.

  • Strong programming skills in python are a strong asset.

  • The desk is closely integrated between traders, quants, and technologists and provides exposure to all aspects of the business. Business intuition and communication skills must be strong.

  • The candidate must be practically minded – he or she must understand how models generate value for the trading operation, what level of sophistication they should have in order to achieve their goals while remaining simple and easy to implement, and how model performance can be evaluated, both in testing and in production. The position requires both attention to detail and the ability to see the “big picture” of the trading operation.

  • 2-7 years of experience in fixed income trading, with an understanding of ETFs

  • Technical and quantitative skills an asset, but not required

  • Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills

  • M.A./M.S. in a quantitative discipline such as computer science, physics, statistics, engineering or financial engineering is required

  • Obtain and maintain all registrations/licenses which are required for your role, within the appropriate timeframe

item.title: Sr. UX Strategist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll work on the Frontline Technology Strategy User Experience (UX) team which is responsible for conceptualizing and designing UX for employee-facing software applications. You’ll partner with other units across the bank to shape and communicate user experience strategies and design, often serving as the team advisor responsible for defining the overall UX vision throughout the digital ecosystem. You’ll apply an user-centred design approach by using various Research methods while integrating Design Thinking, Strategic Foresight and Analytics in order to fulfill the needs of the Business.  You’ll present recommendations to stakeholders and executives based on data, user feedback and insights collected to support with strategic decision making that support a long-term vision.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • UX Strategy – You’ll work with stakeholders and other members of the Frontline UX Team to give valuable input and recommendations to key business decisions with an user-centered mindset. You’ll help define an UX Vision and an UX Roadmap for our direct organization using Strategic Foresight. You’ll leverage core themes and findings from UX Research activities and communicate it to the Business for impactful and meaningful short, medium and long-term strategic decisions, while supporting with prioritizing activities and working closely to the Innovation team.
  • Data Analysis – You’ll give meaning to data by connecting design strategy and business metrics. You will look deeply into human behavioral data e how it shifts among time to propose unique but adoptable solutions and approaches to form a robust UX strategy roadmap.
  • Collaborate - You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team to develop experiences for our clients and employees. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders to help them set a vision for projects, including framing the problems to be solved and defining criteria for project success. You’ll work effectively within constraints, understanding the broader organizational context but also being ready to challenge it when necessary.
  • Research and Present – You’ll promote UX research studies, develop Personas, facilitate discovery sessions, run design thinking workshops, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data. You’ll analyze and translate research data into meaningful insights and powerful stories using artifacts such as customer journey maps, videos and storyboards, executive memos, compelling reports, and townhall presentations that explain unmet needs and present opportunities for change in the future-facing and nearer-term experiences.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centred and client-centred designs to project peers in a collaborative way that supports Business Strategy. Establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with stakeholders, Tech partners, vendors and peers to drive research-led design process.
  • Leadership -  Articulate business value of UX Strategy to stakeholders.

Who You Are

  • You have a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on UX related experience. Team or project Lead experience is an asset.
  • You have a degree/diploma in design and research such as Behavioural Science, Inclusive Design, Data Science, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You are curious and can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

item.title: 200170 - Consultant, Information Security
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You will join CIBC\'s Identity and Access Operations team as an Information Security Consultant to monitor, analyze, review, and remediate access to CIBC\'s technology. You will support the execution of our team\'s mandate by communicating with clients, analyzing data, providing solutions and reporting on key metrics and other defined measurements related to business deliverables and processes. You will provide technical expertise in development and support of all activities, processes, procedures and tools used for validating and insuring the integrity of information security.

You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Identity Analytics and Administration – You have the ability to identify access to infrastructure and data, assess risk of access, determine compliant or appropriate access, and solution for remediation.  This required extensive comprehension of data analysis and ACL.  You have the ability to handle client escalations and prioritize activities. You will drive the identity management and process effectiveness in security processes and understand and follow Identity and Access Management

  • ​Reporting and Metrics – You can identify metrics thresholds and business rules for measuring data quality and ensuring adherence with bank and regulatory standards. You have creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable approach that results in providing CIBC with optimum solutions to business issues/challenges. This includes performing specific data or analysis based on business user requests and contribution to automation of reporting requirements, design documents for data quality & data management. You have advanced experience with Excel and PowerPoint and Tableau and the ability to analyze raw data to provide predictive and prescriptive analytics.

  • Consulting – You will be responsible for collaborating with projects and initiatives to create and execute access management for new/existing infrastructure, aligning with Identity & Access Management (IAM) initiatives and related policies, standards, and procedures to help enhance our information security posture. You will assist other teams in investigation of potential security incidents and provide recommendations to remediate. You have excellent communication skills.

  • Process Improvement – You will recommend solutions to enhance processes, eliminate risks, and improve the speed and quality of key services to our partners. You have the ability to apply appropriate tools to perform problem determination and root cause analysis; identify bottlenecks, redundancies and vulnerabilities of existing processes as they relate to identity and access management. You have excellent documentation skills.  You can link operational activities and risks to controls and standards. You understand risk management framework to incorporate risk assessment to operational and improvement initiatives.  

  • Technical Skills – You have Windows relating to Identity and Access, advanced PowerPoint and Excel. Hands-on experience of the following tools and application is an asset: SailPoint IdentityIQ, ServiceNow, Varonis, ARS/AD

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in Information Security. Knowledge of identity and access management principal is required. It\'s an asset if you have experience with control, compliance, audit testing and provisioning. Experience in advancing continuous improvement agendas including process documentation is an asset. Experience with reporting tools is an asset.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Information Security, Computer Science, or related field experience. Knowledge of multiple infrastructure platforms and tools such as NAS, WINTEL, Active Directory is a must.  

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You\'re ready to lead others. You participate actively in coaching your peers, ready to lead cross functional teams to solve problems.

  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

As a Fusion Reporting Consultant, you will provide expert and specialized reporting.  You will play a key role in the build, reconciliation and automation of operational reporting across Fusion teams.  You will develop Key Performance Indicator (KPI) business benefit, and Key Risk Indicator (KRI) reporting to support Fusion Program delivery.  You will also develop risk, governance, operational, and regulatory reporting for the Fusion team as required. You will be a subject matter expert in developing robust methodologies for reporting and dashboarding. Utilize creative thinking and apply mathematical, financial and statistical methods in the design/development of new analysis to support strategic decision making.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role  you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Reporting – Design, develop and deliver visual reporting using state of the art visual reporting tools. Provide complex analytical reporting capability to Fusion business units based on requirements combined with a business assessment of each functional unit’s business needs. Develop an operational measurement & reporting plan for new initiatives and use cases, as well existing business operations processes. Deliver monthly dashboards such as use case benefits, Operational performance Dashboards, Incident management reporting, Intelligence threat reporting, Executive Business and Partner dashboards which provide Fusion with the ability to measure the success of our business and provide insight into areas to focus.

Create processes and code to automate delivery of new and existing standard analytics & reporting in SAS, Tableau and Microsoft Office. Deliver moderately complex data quality extract and manipulation reviews using SAS / SQL and deliver feedback on those reviews. Apply creative thinking to overcome limitations in data availability and data quality

  • Relationship Management - Develop and maintain productive relationships with management, peers and others across all lines of business. Collaborate with Business Controls, Risk, and regulatory teams.
